reasoning: Cancer-associated cachexia syndrome (weight loss, muscle wasting) develops in 50-80% of cancer patients depending on tumor type. Global cancer incidence ~200 per 100k, with approximately 50-60% developing cachexia yields ~110 per 100k. Higher rates in pancreatic, gastric, and lung cancers.
source: Tisdale MJ. (2002). Cachexia in cancer patients. Nat Rev Cancer. 2(11):862-71
